dict.string: Tap the highlighted button
Tap twice to set the marker
Tap to continue

Professor, welcome to the Console.
Cool interface, isn't it? I hope you like it because you'll spend the next weeks looking at it! Allow me to give you a quick reminder on how does it work.
The Console shows you data collected by satellites deployed around the planet.
The mission takes place inside this landscape. You can zoom in/out pinching the screen, or pan around sliding your finger through the screen.
The landscape is full of features. For example, this hexagon is a mountain.
This arid area here has almost no vegetation. Not a comfy area to live.
Living in these regions will be more difficult because because resources are scarce.
The environment is not always that dangerous. Survival is easier in forests like this one.
The Console shows your bots are these little dots. We have deployed a small initial population in this area.
This first mission is a dispersal. Your bots should arrive to the blinking hexagon in your bottom right.
You will supervise that the bots arrive there within the time span identified in the archaeological evidence. The closer you get, the better.
Tap the Play button to see what are your bots doing.
The bots move, reproduce and die without your intervention. We developed some cool tools to guide them to the mission objectives.
The first one is the orientation marker. Tap twice in any place of the map to suggest the direction of dispersion to your population.
The second one is the evolution track. You begin with 10 EvoPoints and receive additional points during the mission..
EvoPoints are used to increase the three attributes. Tap here to spend 1 EvoPoint and upgrade Mobility to Level 2.
Reproduction controls the fertility of your bots. Move it to level 2.
Each change of an attribute costs 1 additional EvoPoints, as it is highlighted in yellow. Increase it to 3.
Tap again to set Reproduction to 4.
Increasing Resistance improves the survival skills of your bots. Spend the remanining on this attribute.
Use the remaining 2 EvoPoints to increase Resistance again.
Deployment finished! Let's see if the bots survive with these traits.
This panel shows how your population is increasing. Set now the orientation marker within the goal zone.
As you can see here you received additional EvoPoints.
You should now increase Resistance and then focus on Mobility. Good luck!
Some missions have more than one goal as shown in the top of the Console.
You have to arrive to each goal within the bright interval. If you arrive before or after this span the mission will fail.
The best arrival time suggested by the evidence is marked by the highlighted zone.
A final note: regions like this mountain range are too hostile to your bots, so your bots cannot live there.
Welcome Professor! We are having problems understanding what happened in this zone so you have a new tool in your console: the T.A.P.A.T.B.C.T.
This is the acronym for Temporary Augmentation of Population Attributes Through Bursts in Cultural Traits. Beautiful, isn't it?
So...to avoid any strokes the team simply called them Boosts.

They basically allow you temporaly increase one attribute of your population. You spend EvoPoints using Boosts, so you need to balance changing your attributes with these short-term improvements. After you use them they need a cooldown period because we don't want the population to rely on this external factor to achieve its goals.
You got two Boosts for this mission. The first one affects your entire population, and increases its rate of reproduction. Press it now.
Please don't ask how did we achieve this baby boom...
The second Boost increases the Resistance of the bots in a particular zone. You can tap and drag the finger to the area of effect when you have the needed EvoPoints
Both will be needed to see how did they manage to cross the arid zones of this map.
Distribute your initial EvoPoints and tap Play whenever you are ready.
Good luck!
It seems that the archaeologists have new clues so let's repeat the last experiment with this new evidence.
Technological development was quite relevant here so you have control over this attribute instead of Reproduction. On the other hand the available time to reach your goals is considerable shorter
It is a peculiar attribute; it is not aparticular behavior of your population, but all of them. When you increase your Technology all the other attributes increase their efficiency
Try dispersing your population towards the arid zones increasing their technological skills.
Good luck!
Welcome, Professor. For the first time your bots will have to share this landscape with other populations. The zone around this river was populated before our arrival.
Interaction between population is a complex process with a diversity of outcomes; it will range from trade and cultural exchange to open conflict. Usually it is a mix of all these processes.
It seems that this first contact with another species was not extremely peaceful. Both of them moved south to colonize these arid zones due to environmental stress caused by overpopulation.
You'll have to use Resistance boosts and Technology to arrive to the different objectives. You should avoid the other population, as they are far more experience on warfare than you.
Good luck Professor!
Greetings Professor. We have another situation of interaction with a different species.
We are certain that this population did not have enough mobility to reach the objectives within the time recorded by archaeologists.
This population seems to have increased their mobility so we have added a Boost to this attribute
On the other hand, a long time ago someone said that if you can't beat your enemies you can always force them to join you...so we have added another attribute called Influence

We are confident that superior mobility and cultural influence would allow your population to ally with the other species and achieve your objectives. It will definitely be faster than fighting them while dispersing.
Good luck Professor!
Conflict is unfortunately often present in competition, and this planet is not an exception
We know that our population engaged on warfare against these poor little blue dots...
We need to replicate this so you have another attribute here called Warfare
Both populations will try to disperse to the richer zones displayed here; make sure that our bots are the ones that takes control of the area
Good luck Professor!
We have here a peculiar situation...your population will get involved with two radically different species
The yellow bots are extremely agressive
In contrast, the blue ones have a strong cultural influence even if their military strength is weak
Our population alternated both strategies, so you have here a couple of new Boosts to use
Good luck Professor!
